intro: Phanrangia poilanei, commonly known as the Malabar mountain bean, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, pod-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
